wiki.content: In this track, X is giving his thoughts on the killings and robberies around the world using such lines as “kill a woman with many children? Makes you a chump” and lines like it. He hates the world we live in where it’s all about hatred and violence and he wrote RIOT to show that he doesn’t want this world to go down in a flaming ball of death. He’s letting everyone, old and young, know that this world is going to the shitter. Given that X was speaking against violence, the outro creates a significant contrast by showing the immense hatred and violence that the Ku Klux Klan perpetrated. He is almost comparing the senseless violence of rioters to that of the racist KKK members that they condemn. RIOT was also included in the music video for X’s most popular song, Look At Me!, which was released on September 12, 2017. The song was rereleased on June 1, 2020 amid the George Floyd protests. In the rerelease, most of the outro was removed. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
